thread.title: JPMorgan Earnings Miss As Sales Fall Trumps Cost Cuts JPM OZRK BAC - Investors.com
thread.title_full: JPMorgan Earnings Miss As Sales Fall Trumps Cost Cuts JPM OZRK BAC - Investors.com

author: yahoo
title: JPMorgan Earnings Miss As Sales Fall Trumps Cost Cuts JPM OZRK BAC - Investors.com
text:
J PMorgan Chase's third-quarter earnings missed estimates late Monday as cost curbs failed to fully offset the third year-over-year revenue decline in four quarters due to choppy markets. 
The biggest U.S. bank earned $1.32 a share excluding various items — including a $2.2 billion tax benefit — down from $1.36 a year earlier. Revenue fell 6.4% to $23.5 billion. Analysts polled by Thomson Reuters expected EPS of $1.37 on revenue of $23.7 billion. 
JPMorgan Chase (NYSE: JPM ) said Q4 EPS estimates seem "too high." JPMorgan Chase is the first of the big U.S. lenders to report in the third quarter. AP  View Enlarged Image 

JPMorgan stock fell 1.3% late after closing down 0.3% at 61.55. 
Total assets were $2.4 trillion as of Sept. 30, down 1% from a year earlier. Return on tangible common equity was 15%, up two percentage points from Q3 '14. Common equity Tier 1 ratio was an estimated 11.4%. 
Trading revenue slipped 15% to $4.34 billion. Citigroup (NYSE: C ) and Bank of America (NYSE: BAC ) previously said they expected their Q3 trading revenue to decline 5%-6%. 
Loans grew 9% to $809.5 billion. JPMorgan hailed the "exceptional" credit quality of its loans. 
Net interest margin, the difference between what the bank earns in loans vs. what it pays deposits, rose seven basis points. But the spread remains relatively low with the Federal Reserve keeping rates near zero. 
Costs Fall, But Not Enough 
Headcount fell 3% to 235,678 employees on Sept. 30. JPMorgan has begun to cut more than 5,000 jobs to trim expenses by $1.4 billion to $57 billion. 
Total JPMorgan Chase bank branches fell 3% to 5,471 while ATMs slid 9% to 18,623. 
Non-interest expense rose 6% vs. Q2 to $15.4 billion, but it fell 3% from a year earlier. 
Consumer and business banking net income rose 3% to $954 million. Mortgage banking net income grew 29% to $602 million. The cards, commerce solutions and auto-loans unit's net income fell 6% to $1.1 billion. 
Investment-banking revenue rose 5% to $1.6 billion, but JPMorgan reported a 35% fall in equity underwriting fees to $269 million. Advisory fees for mergers and acquisitions rose 22% to $503 million. Debt-underwriting fees grew 17% to $840 million. 
Legal expenses surged to $1.3 billion from $291 million in Q2 and $1.1 billion a year earlier. The bank reportedly is nearing a $150 million settlement with the SEC to resolve allegations that it didn't provide proper disclosures to its private-banking clients before steering them to its own investment products. 
Wells Fargo (NYSE: WFC ) and Bank of America report earnings Wednesday. Citigroup and Goldman Sachs (NYSE: GS ) report Thursday, and Morgan Stanley next Monday. 
Bank Of The Ozarks Misses 
Meanwhile, Arkansas-based Bank of the Ozarks (NASDAQ: OZRK ) reported earnings 52 cents a share, up 30% from a year earlier but missing views by a penny. 
Total assets rose 42% to $9.3 billion. While a sliver of JPMorgan's size, Bank of the Ozarks boasts a best-possible 99 Composite Rating, meaning it tops 99% of stocks on a variety of fundamental and technical factors. 
Ozarks stock fell 2% after hours after losing 0.8%.
